title.native: 明日ちゃんのセーラー服

description:
It’s Komichi Akebi’s first year of junior high and she has her heart set on one thing: Robai Private Academy’s sailor uniform. As the next chapter of her life gets closer, she dreams of all the exciting new experiences she’ll get to have—school lunches, classes, club activities, and of course, making lots of friends! With her favorite outfit on, Komichi feels ready for anything.

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: ชุดกะลาสีของอาเคบิจัง

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Feet
tags.description: Features the sexual depiction or stimulation of a character's feet.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Cheerleading
tags.description: Centers around the activity of cheerleading.

tags.name: Tennis
tags.description: Centers around the sport of tennis.

tags.name: Swimming
tags.description: Centers around the sport of swimming.

tags.name: Volleyball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of volleyball.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Fishing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of fishing.

tags.name: Photography
tags.description: Centers around the use of cameras to capture photos.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/880805780844183553)

Affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks). 

Freelancer originating from [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/), formerly a [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) employee. 

Married to [Akira Amemiya](https://anilist.co/staff/100956/).
Originating from Studio WHO. Currently affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyafic)

The representative director of Capsule, a CG animation company

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/880805780844183553)

Affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks). 

Freelancer originating from [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/), formerly a [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) employee. 

Married to [Akira Amemiya](https://anilist.co/staff/100956/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/USUI_H)

Director of the Background Art Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

Wanted to pursue a career in anime after having seen [Princess Mononoke](https://anilist.co/anime/164/) while still in high school. The art depiction of the movie's setting made her want to become a background artist. She entered the industry in 2002, and joined Studio Who, a background art studio ran by [Tsutomu Fujita](https://anilist.co/staff/147331/). Later she joined Studio Easter and worked on many of [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/)' projects, most notably making her debut as an art director on [Idolmaster](https://anilist.co/anime/10278/). She has since served as an art director on [Your Lie in April](https://anilist.co/anime/20665/), [Occultic;Nine](https://anilist.co/anime/21708/), [Horimiya](https://anilist.co/anime/124080/) among others.

Utatane Kana is a lyricist, composer, arranger and pianist from Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan. She works for Tawara and is part of KanadeYUK.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Utatanekana)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/濱野高年)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/880805780844183553)

Affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks). 

Freelancer originating from [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/), formerly a [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) employee. 

Married to [Akira Amemiya](https://anilist.co/staff/100956/).
__Yoshihisa Heishi__ is a Japanese magazine editor, animation planner and producer. He currently works for Shueisha and was an editor-in-chief for Weekly Shounen Jump between 2011-2017.
